output_questions.question: Sample text
output_questions.explanation: Both properties are applied to the paragraph, making the text blue and 20px in size.

output_questions.question: Important
output_questions.explanation: The heading will have red text and a yellow background.

output_questions.question: Big Heading
output_questions.explanation: The `<h2>` element gets a font size of 30px.

output_questions.question: Bold green text
output_questions.output: Bold green text
output_questions.explanation: CSS ignores whitespace and newlines, applying both properties.

output_questions.question: This is italic text.
output_questions.explanation: The span is italicized while the rest of the text is unchanged.

output_questions.question: Link
output_questions.explanation: The link appears blue and has no underline.

output_questions.question:
• One
  • Two
output_questions.explanation: List items in the unordered list use square bullets.

output_questions.question:
Title

Subtitle
output_questions.explanation: Both headers are centered due to the combined selector.

output_questions.question: Error?
output_questions.explanation: The CSS is invalid due to missing semicolon between 'red' and 'font-size', so the browser ignores the styles.

output_questions.question: What color?
output_questions.explanation: The second rule overrides the first, so the paragraph is green.

output_questions.question: Box
output_questions.explanation: A border and padding are applied to the div.

output_questions.question: Commented CSS
output_questions.explanation: CSS comments are ignored by the browser.

output_questions.question: Example
output_questions.explanation: Both background and text color are set for the paragraph.

output_questions.question: Font Example
output_questions.explanation: The font family is set for the entire page.

output_questions.question: Style order?
output_questions.explanation: Both properties are applied; order does not affect the result since both target the same element.
